asgn2Customers

Class Customer

  • java.lang.Object
    • asgn2Customers.Customer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DriverDeliveryCustomer, DroneDeliveryCustomer, PickUpCustomer

    public abstract class Customer
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract class to represent a customer at the Pizza Palace restaurant. The Customer class is used as a base class of PickUpCustomer, DriverDeliveryCustomer and DroneDeliverCustomer. Each of these subclasses overwrites the abstract method getDeliveryDistance. A description of the class's fields and their constraints is provided in Section 5.2 of the Assignment Specification.
    Author:
    Person B

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Customer(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String mobileNumber, int locationX, int locationY, java.lang.String type)
      This class represents a customer of the Pizza Palace restaurant.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
      Compares *this* Customer object with an instance of an *other* Customer object and returns true if if the two objects are equivalent, that is, if the values exposed by public methods are equal.
      java.lang.String getCustomerType()
      Returns a human understandable description of the Customer's type.
      abstract double getDeliveryDistance()
      An abstract method that returns the distance between the Customer and the restaurant depending on the mode of delivery.
      int getLocationX()
      Returns the Customer's X location which is the number of blocks East or West that the Customer is located relative to the Pizza Palace restaurant.
      int getLocationY()
      Returns the Customer's Y location which is the number of blocks North or South that the Customer is located relative to the Pizza Palace restaurant.
      java.lang.String getMobileNumber()
      Returns the Customer's mobile number.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the Customer's name.

        getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Customer

        public Customer(java.lang.String name,
                java.lang.String mobileNumber,
                int locationX,
                int locationY,
                java.lang.String type)
         throws CustomerException
        This class represents a customer of the Pizza Palace restaurant. A detailed description of the class's fields and parameters is provided in the Assignment Specification, in particular in Section 5.2. A CustomerException is thrown if the any of the constraints listed in Section 5.2 of the Assignment Specification are violated.

        PRE: True

        POST: All field values are set

        Parameters:
        name - - The Customer's name
        mobileNumber - - The customer mobile number
        locationX - - The customer x location relative to the Pizza Palace Restaurant measured in units of 'blocks'
        locationY - - The customer y location relative to the Pizza Palace Restaurant measured in units of 'blocks'
        type - - A human understandable description of this Customer type
        Throws:
        CustomerException - if supplied parameters are invalid

        public final java.lang.String getCustomerType()

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
        Compares *this* Customer object with an instance of an *other* Customer object and returns true if if the two objects are equivalent, that is, if the values exposed by public methods are equal. You do not need to test this method.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        true if *this* Customer object and the *other* Customer object have the same values returned for getName(),getMobileNumber(),getLocationX(),getLocationY(),getCustomerType().
